decoworld.model.world.worlditems

Class DestructibleItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • decoworld.model.world.entities.WorldEntity
      • decoworld.model.world.entities.combat.StatEntity
        • decoworld.model.world.worlditems.DestructibleItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasSync, HasCollision, HasMouseOver, HasStats, StatListener, HasPhysicsBox, HasLocation, HasRotation, WorldItem, HasItemLabel, HasWorldItemEvent, java.lang.Iterable<StatType>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DestructibleJar

    public class DestructibleItem
extends StatEntity
implements HasPhysicsBox, HasCollision, HasWorldItemEvent
    Destructible Item Class. This item is designed to block the players advance through the level, yet it is destructible. This object is meant to be able to be collided with, have a health stat and a physics box. When the player hits the item, the health will on each hit until it is dead.

    Current Functionality: - Takes damage by being run into by the player (easily updatable to take damage from more specific items) - Image changes as the item takes damage - Upon full damage, the item disappears completely. - Drops a health potion. - Currently doesn't respawn in its place.

    Created by jason on 18/08/14. Modified by sarahnelson on 16/10/2014.

    • Method Detail

      • onTick

        public void onTick(long stepSize)
        OnTick will serve as the respawn timer for this class. Once an item is destroyed, the isDead flag is set true and the timer will start counting. After some time, the item will be respawned, the isDead flag sill be set false, and the item will be filled with health again. The timer will start again next time the item dies.
        Overrides:
        onTick in class StatEntity
        Parameters:
        stepSize - the step size of elapsed time.

      • onCollisionEvent

        public void onCollisionEvent(CollisionEvent event)
        Handles the collision events. Currently the tree takes health damage by being run into by the player, this can be easily changed when the design of the game progresses. 30 damage points are applied, and the player is bounced back.
        Specified by:
